Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, performance, battery life
Cons: noting
I wanted a tablet, but one that would give me full access to websites, so no iPad for me. The Acer Iconia A200 came along at a great price point and I have not need for a camera on a tablet.
For e-mail, web browsing, magazine and book reading, this is absolutely great. Also, having a file system (which iPad does not), gives me semi-laptop capabilities. I now use my laptop only about 1/2 as much as pre-tablet.
Screen resolution is fine, battery life very good, tablet is easy to hold an use.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen size. Solid construction. Thin and light weight. Responsive internet. Ease of set up.
Cons: The nice time/date widget is always reading 1 hour ahead of actual time!!!! Needs a update for this issue.
The Acer A200 is fantastic for the money. Set up is easy. Wireless connection flawless. Performance is excellent. The Droid Market readily available. The touch screen is responsive. Screen clarity is nice. Installed apps are the usual apps a user would want installed. I did not intend on playing any type of graphic intensive games but I have to say one game I did load to test (3D space game) is a blast to play and graphics are excellent. Overall, the tablet is top notch for the price. Using the tablet to surf the internet is a pleasure. Pages load quickly. Video is pl ... ayed without issue. Sound is a bit on the low side for me. The two speakers are on the back of the tablet and project away from the user. Then again, it is not a stereo system and not advertised as one. The sound quality is good though. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

There's tons of storage and I love the speaker sound (through earphones).

I read and read many reviews. I make sure when I purchase something it is the right one for me and the best product for the money!

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: good price fast and stable
Cons: no hdmi or rear camera
For the price this is the best tablet out there right now! I have the 64 gig Asus Prime and find myself using the Acer much more. The web pages load much quicker and gps locks right away! vs the Prime. I love the feel of the rubber back. If you have low sound from the speakers install the Equalizer App and set the boost to 100% it doubled my output.
I've tried several wireless windows based keyboard and they have all worked! The mini hp keyboard wireless is the same size it uses a MHz USB connection. I'm very tempted to sell my prime!

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Tablet at a Great Price
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality Construction; Reliable; Easy to Use; Efficient; Easy To Set Up
Amazing tablet at an amazing price. It has impressed me on all levels. Screen is great, battery life is great, I do my college work on it with no problem, even plug in a USB keyboard to make typing easier. The Tegra 2 processor makes gaming even more enjoyable and I haven't noticed any lag whatsoever when multitasking.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Bright; Professional Weight
This tablet is just what I was looking for. The Tegra2 processor is fast and responsive and the Android 4.0 operating system is very stable.
I use the tablet for work and teaching, I loaded the full version of Documents to go and a MS Project viewer, andno longer take paper to meetings. The micro SD slot and USB ports provide for unlimited storage capacity.
The internal speakers are acceptable, and sound quality is great with headphones. Video play is high quality and very smooth. Surfing the web is fast and reliable. Overall, this tablet does exactly what I want it to and is probably the best value for the price based on the research I did before I purchased it.
This review was posted from my tablet.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Do you really need a tablet?
Item.Review:
Pros: compact, android market apps, price
Cons: A tablet is not a laptop.
I was in the market for a new netbook and decided to get a tablet. For a tablet, I think it works well enough. Not very powerful, you must do one thing at a time. Speaker volume is almost non existent. I'm sure many of you are like me, not realizing the many drawbacks of tablet. Let me summarize: it is simply for web browsing, gaming, organization, and portability. Simply a bigger version of your smartphone, no extras. Limited word processing, website access, very difficult to do simple things like copy and paste in browser. Touch screen response is finicky on some apps. Can not for the life of me get Temple Run to ... run... properly. I do enjoy my tablet, but mostly for the gaming. I will eventually g ... et a netbook like I originally intended expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Low price for a good product
Item.Review: I like the tablet. Maybe not the most fast, but not a big problem. For the price has a good performance, the battery lasts several hours, connectivity via wi fi is fast. Good product.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Battery life, screen, application options, email, picture view, internet surfing, price
Cons: N/A
Tablet is awesome; I bought it for personal use as well as business travel. The battery life was much better than expected. I used it on a 3 day business trip and only had to charge once (it wasn't even completely drained.) Easily logs into wifi and connects to any network. User friendly UI, and easy to pick up how to use.
Great for email, browsing internet and my niece and nephew love to play games on it. Can sync to other android devices based on Gmail, so I didn't have to start from square one with Apps. Can use web cam for Skype chats and e-reader (and Kindle app) are great. HIGHLY recommend. You aren’t going to get a better tablet without spending double.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

Cons: For some, no rear camera
Works GREAT!!!! Doesn't have a rear camera, but its not a feature I would use anyway. Great for the price. A little heavier than an Asus or Samsung,but much cheaper also. USB port is great to have as well.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen size,battery life, ease of use and everyhing else
Cons: Nothing
I bought this tablet at the end of January and so far I love it. I use it some for my business (getting emails, web searches, calendar) and for personal (facebook, internet, reading books and some music). While at home I can leave it on standby for several days at a time and always comes right back from sleep mode easily. The screen is so vivid and large it's amazing. There are a few of the preinstalled apps I don't use so I just moved them to one of the other screens I don't use - easy fix. It isn't a bose sound system but yet I find the sound quality to be pretty good and no complaints. This was my first android product and I loved it so much, I got rid of my 1 year old iphone and upgraded ... to an android smartphone. Now, my home computer syncs between the tablet and phone which I love. Overall, I have no complaints and I'm very happy with my acer tablet. expand » « collapse

love it,set up was fast and simple.works fine. Nice price and no need to buy special adapters.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up and use. Good price
Cons: wish battery lasted longer
This is my first tablet and I really like it, but I wish it had 3G service. Wi fi is great but sometimes in my area Wi Fi is not available. So far I haven't had any problems with the Acer. I have had it about a month now.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Good piece of equip. for $$ - not happy w/SD slot
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to set up, lots of internal memory
Cons: Can't move apps to the SD card
Got it 1/28. replacing an Arnova 10 G2 (piece of junk). Set up is real easy and quick. Getting and installing apps piece of cake (mostly Amazon app store). Put most of what I wanted on tablet and memory still ok. Sound not that big a deal for me. Only reason not 5 stars is that although there is an Sd slot, you can't move any apps from the device to the SD card. ALL apps go into the internal memory. First time I've seen that with an Android device. Not sure if this is a deal killer or not. I'll give it a week and see. Customer support answered my email within 1 hour. not bad for a saturday. I would recommend to a friend but would mention the SD card issue.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Build quality and value for the money
Cons: Sound quality is low
I bought my Iconia A200 on Monday Jan 16 from Best Buy. I am very impressed by the features offered and that will be upgradeable for free to Ice Cream Sandwich. Also, it is compatible with Adobe Flash. Screen size and resolution are very good. Widgets, apps, and the new Acer Ring are fun to use. Ports are very convenient to have. I don't care much for cameras on computers, laptop or tablets, so I could care less for not having a rear camera. Battery live is good. Last me 2 days on average use. The downside of this tablet will be the speakers. Sound quality is tiny and weak. Other than that I am very happy with my purchase.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: The reviews are accurate. We like this tablet!
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use and responsiveness are great.
Cons: It doesn't do my laundry.
My wife is computer challenged and I'm a geek at heart. This is ideal for her and a pleasure for me. She requires little tech support from yours truly and I enjoy the straight forward web surfing. It's quick to boot up and you are off and running. She enjoys Netflix and I play a few games that use the motion sensors and touch screen. I especially like all the thousands of Droid apps. This isn't a gamer PC or a dumbed down overpriced iPad. It is as simple or complicated as you want it to be. 16gb of onboard memory expandable to 32 is plenty. The USB slot allows you to go even higher. You can edit word docs or spreadsheets but why? It's best at what it was designed for, a social media and internet p ... ortal. It has a quality build and feel. We are 2 months into ownership and pick it up more and more each day. We will take it with us to Maui to keep in touch with family and upload pics of good times! Best is we bought it on sale $349. Cheers everyone! ;-) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: This is not a tablet, it's a computer.
Item.Review: I am amazed by the capabilities of this tablet! It is such a good deal. The price might be an initial shock, however, this thing functions just like a computer. I can type (and print) papers for school. I can watch movies. I listen to music. I can also organize my life. I recommend buying an actual keyboard. I bought a Bluetooth one and it functions fine on the go. But, at home, I attach a full size USB keyboard, and it works just like my old home computer. It is quick and durable. Skype works excellent. I can go a full two days without charging, the wifi being on. It really is a great computer replacement. I recommend this over the others out there because it has a USB port and expandable SD memory. Similar tablets....with a certain "apple" logo, if you catch my drift, don't. 16 GB is alr ... eady enough memory and so much more worth it with this tablet. I love it! You will too, guaranteed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Very convenient around the house. Kids love it.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to navigate. Fast. Plenty of memory. Slim and light. Great for keeping up with our email.
Cons: Speakers on back make it difficult to hear sometimes, especially when watching movies.
Overall a nice tablet. Very easy to use and simple to navigate. Battery lasts all day even with heavy use. Using an Android phone prior to the tablet greatly flattened the learning curve for me in terms of learning to navigate, knowing useful utility apps to download, etc.. The speakers aren't great. And I was disappointed that there is not way to output video to a TV (if there is, I haven't figured out how to do it yet). But for what we use the device for (games, reading, email) it works great.

Item.Review: I mainly use the tablet around the home and when travelling. I rate it a 4 + as it has basically everything that I need. Graphics are great,speed and the wifi gives a very strong consistant signal. It has it's typical bloatware loaded, but then what doesn't? The USB and mini USB ports are a plus, and don't forget about the SD card slot. Overall I'm very pleased with the A200 and recommend others to consider it!

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: It's a great deal, and a geat deal more.
Item.Review: The Iconia 16GB Tab A series 10.1 is one of the best electronic devices I have ever purchased. I have gotten so much for the money. I also went back to B&H within a week and purchased one for my husband, who is just as happy with it as I am. It's as if someone put all the little devices into one. I love the clarity of the screen, and the user friendly ways I can operate it. I can't emagine anything else being produced that could improve this tablet. It keeps me mobile, and so happy I am the owner. I have only one complaint, when I have finished reading my e-mails it is difficult to delete them. Eventually they are deleted, but with much difficulty. I re ... commend this Tablet to everyone. Also, I purchased a black sleeve for my tablet and enhanced it with stick-on jewelry, which made it so much more unique. Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:

I purchased this tablet in February and have had no issues to date. The screen resolution is good, sound is decent, and speed has been great. The only negative I have found is the difficulty finding accessories (case, etc.) for this tablet.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Android Tablet - good alternative to iPad
Item.Review:
Pros: Versatility
Cons: few accessories
I think the price for this tablet is just right for what you get. I added the 32 Gb micro SD card and have no troubles storing a season or two of my favorited TV shows and several movies. The wifi is quite good and very capable (I use it for wifi survey to help determine the best channel for my home network). It's great for reading too, I have the Nook, Kindle and Google Books apps installed and enjoy using them all. The included Zinio magazine app is great for magazine reading too . The sound quality is a bit week from the rear speakers, but with headphones it's just fine. The only shortfall I can find right now is the extreme lack of accessories for the Iconia tab A200, but this should improve with time since the A500 is discontinued.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Even with one dead, it's still a great tablet
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, very responsive, a tablet that gives choice back to consumers
Cons: Speaker volume.
I received this as a gift on a Friday. After letting it charge, I customized settings and went on a download rampage until about 5:00 in the morning. After using it pretty heavily over the weekend, Sunday evening it just died. No warning, just ... nothing. The light did not turn on, and it would not take a charge. Not that I was too worried about it though, (the gift giver had purchased a warranty with it). I just exchanged it for a new one, just got back now, and am charging the new one to try again.
Even after this experience, it still does not deter me from absolutely loving this tablet. The wealth of features, the USB 2.0 slot, the fact that I can watch Netflix in the ki ... tchen, these things are the reason why I wanted this tablet.
Yes, the speaker volume stinks, but you can download an app for free called equalizer, and just push all the sliders to the max settings and it boosts the volume, (granted, it distorts the volume), or, just buy the Logitech clip on speakers for it. Also, it lacks an HDMI output and rear camera, but so what? If it keeps the cost down to this price, I say good riddance to features you won't use but a few times anyway, if at all.
The fact that the item died after just two days of use does not speak to the quality of the Acer a200 brand, it speaks of the build of the particular tablet I happened to receive. Sometimes things don't work. You return em. Easy. I'm just glad it happened in the first few days, and not after I really got into this machine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

The speakers only work in certain environments, so you'll want to have some headphones in noisy rooms. Don't really care that it doesn't have a rear camera - Thats why I have a phone and a camera. The front camera is great for skype.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review: I bought this tablet to read my pdf and ebup books, watch videos on the go.. It's absolutely perfect for that.. The upgrade to icecream sandwich (4. 0.3)didn't hurt either. Wifi, gps all work great out of the box. Has great battery life. What isn't so great about it? the display : the colors aren't as vibrant as say, the galaxy tab, but then again, this cost way less than that.. I did have some occasions where the screen would be unresponsive.... Doesn't happen all the time so it doesn't bother me. I the ffc doesn't take great pictures, but for Skype, it does a decent job. Overall if you want bang for your buck, the a200 is a great buy! I haven't put mine down since I got it!

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Good tablet, but has some extreme annoyances
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, expandability, screen
Cons: Auto-shuts off while in sleep mode for too long, speakers are quiet, too many preloaded apps.
This tablet is pretty good for the price. It's cheaper than most and it comes with the exact same hardware (which is why I bought it over the Samsung 8.9). My problem with it is that you cannot keep it in sleep mode!! If I put this thing in sleep mode, 1 hour later it will have shut itself off completely, preventing me from receiving my push email and app notifications, and requiring me to wait another 2 minutes to turn it on. I really hate this, and it's pretty much a dealbreaker for me. I contacted Acer and all they could tell me was to press the reset button and try again. Well that didn't work, and neither did a hard reset of the whole dev ... ice. My second annoyance is that it does not have a basic file manager. The file manager is a pre-loaded app called ASTRO that comes with advertisements. I just want to see my folders without getting bombarded with Ads!! Third annoyance- three strikes and you're out with me. There are too many useless apps that are preloaded and cannot be uninstalled (without the warranty-voiding root, of course). Even the facebook bookmark to the browser cannot be uninstalled!! The speakers are terribly quiet and unimpressive compared to Samsung and Asus, but with the Equalizer App you can adjust them to be louder. If Acer could fix the sleep mode issue, I would keep this tablet solely because of the price.. The other annoyances I can tolerate, but the auto-shut-off I cannot. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen, Features, Price
Got tired of trying to read books and news feeds on my ipod so I figured it was time for my first tablet. 10.1" is a good size for reading while on the treadmill or hanging out on the couch. Cutting out a few features I didn't care about saved me some money in this tablet. Its like they made it custom order exactly what I wanted.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

Item.Review:
Pros: Speedy, responsive, great price

I started out with the Kindle Fire on Christmas, gave that to my girlfriend, bought myself a Galaxy 7" Plus, returned it 10 days later and exchanged it for this A200. Acer has hit a home run with this tablet, my girlfriend liked it so much I gave the Kindle Fire to my niece and bought her the A100 so she can for it in her purse. (She wanted to stick w/the 7") In my opinion this is one of the best tablets available (January 2012) and I have been through alot over the past year. Android released Honeycomb which is better suited for tablets and I love it, I can't wait for the 4.0 update next month. I Googled Honeycomb tips and discovered a tip to prevent the browser from auto directing you to mobile version we ... bsites, which really makes this just as good as a laptop or desktop for browsing the web. The only time I have touched my desktop and laptop since I got this was to right click on my computer and enable sharing, which has allowed me to listen to music from my other PC's and allow me to view pics and movies I have on those hard drives. I dont need a rear camera, my phone has a 8 MP, and the lack of mini HDMI doesn't bother me, I bought the mini HDMI cable and used it once with my phone the day I bought it, so no biggie. I would recommend this tablet to anyone wanting a very well made tablet, with a great os, the rubber backing on this tablet makes it feel secure in your hand, the screen is beautiful, the tablet feels very sturdy, I have dropped it twice and no cracks, everything feels just as snug as day 1. I really don't need anything that has an "I" before its name, they are over priced, and don't really seem to perform that well in my opinion. This tablet performs just as good if not better. I've been spending $700-$1000 every 2 years on a laptop, so I believe the tablet market will allow me to get a new tab every year for about the same price. I have 1 small complaint about sound, I've noticed the advertisement before a video will be loud, but the video itself ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Four Star Overall, but Best In This Price range
Item.Review:
Pros: Sturdy build, fast processor, runs Honeycomb well. Battery life is good. Sound is decent.
Cons: OS/browser deficiencies cause some web pages to not load in an optimized fashion.
I'll be real with you and say if you want Bells and Whistles, this is not the tablet for you. This is very no-frills. The feel of it is solid and sturdy. It's not "sexy." It only has a front-facing camera (good for video chat and video blogging and quick snapshots and that's about it.) It lacks HDMI.
If you want a solid, fast Android tablet that has the kind of under-the-hood power that can run anything on the market currently, this is a perfect tablet.
Upgrade to ICS comes in mid-February according to all reports I've read. Applications run well and load quickly. The down-side is ... that there is no Hulu support for this device yet.
A lot of people point to Flash being a plus, but this tends to drain battery and not load as quickly as its HTML 5 counterparts. Some websites which load quickly and easily on an iPad only load their phone-convenient equivilents in Android. If you do get the "Desktop" version it tends to be slower as it is not optimized for the browser/device. Flash-based videos can be awkward and clunky at times. If you have the ability to load a video in the YouTube app, do it - this is much more stable than running a flash video directly from its website. (This is a problem with the OS, not with the device itself.)
I still prefer the iOS devices to Android, but as Droid devices go, this is a pretty good one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, comes with ICS, good wifi speeds, USB host, fast multitasking
Cons: Considering its not the newest thing on the market, theres not much to complain about.
I needed something for college for taking notes, reading books, and doing other school related things, as well as something I could have some fun with. On a budget and opposed to lugging around a big laptop between classes (I would've gotten an Asus gaming latptop), I decided to save some money and get an android tablet.
When I got the a200, there was a noticeable lag with the default homescreen, but its an easy fix. Just install nova launcher.
The tegra 2 does excellent in most games. GTA3, minecraft, and other 3d games run smooth as butter even on high settings.
The USB host is exce ... llent. You can easily transfer data between the tablet and other android devices, use keyboards and mice, and even use an XBOX360 controller with supported games.
Rooting the device is pretty simple, although theres not many roms for it yet. Grezzaarom is a nice, de-bloated, stock ish rom with gapps, su, and superuser installed.
The camera isnt great but it accomplishes what its there for which is video chat. Also, the speakers sound good, but being on the back means its hard to hear when the tablet is lying down.
Overall, for what you pay, the a200 is an excellent device. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: big screen, expandable storage, capacitive touch
Cons: feels pixelated, only front camera
the tablet as itself, it is actually pretty good. feels nice to hold, doesn't slip, and the audio is reasonably good. i played around with it as much as possible and in some points it felt better than my iPad, but others it truly fell behind. My biggest issue is with the screen itself. everything just looked so pixelated and washed out, depending on the app. watching netflix and hulu is nice. it is actually really easy and enjoyable. the fact that it has bluetooth, wifi and usb is great, because I can connect my wireless mouse and keyboard to work on text documents. I tried several web browsers and i just did not like navigating the web on it. Not really the tablet's fa ... ult, but it didn't feel as enjoyable to surf the net. video conferencing isn't so bad, but because you only have the front low resolution camera, don't expect anything amazing. the battery last a really long time, too bad it won't charge via usb. After updating it to the latest Android version, it didn't feel that much better. the Wifi works slightly better, but that's about the only difference I found. The GPS is actually handy and it really is one of the features that caught my eye. Too bad there is no HDMI out. That and the lack of a back camera are this tablets biggest misses. But for everything else, I don't see it as something bad, even if you aren't partial to a brand or OS. I even liked it better than the Samsung Galaxy 2 tablet. I find myself using this tablet just to test android apps i work on, as well as some ebooks, because it is a nice midrange tablet. however, it does not compete with my iPad 2. expand » « collapse

This tablet was one of the best priced and has great features that some of the others do not and the price is 50 dollars better than any of them. With the USB port, the HDMI port and the ability to add an SD card (32 gigs went in today) this table has all I needed.

Netflix works great, internet radio works great and my speakers are plenty loud for me to hear thing playing on it (I even have some hearing loss, and they still play fine).

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Android 4.03, 10.1" screen, full sized USB port
Cons: Needs a case and screen protector
As soon as I booted my Acer Iconia A200 up it notified me that there was an update available - which was then followed by another. Easily within an hour of turning it on I was running Android 4.03. The 10.1" screen is adequate for reading all but the smallest print, and the full-sized USB port allows me to use an full-sized SD-Card reader to import photos from my digital camera for editing and upload. After adding a 32GB class 10 microSD card to the included microSD card slot I have more storage space than I really know what to do with. While some may complain about weight or thickness, this isn't much of a problem for me since I'd be adding (and did add) a protective case anyw ... ay. I don't miss an HDMI output as the last thing I want to do with my portable tablet is to tether it to my HDTV on the wall. I have my Blu-Ray player for that sort of thing. The 802.11n wi-fi works very well and connects extremely rapidly. The system as a whole functions quickly enough for my needs, although one of the PDF programs I use could benefit from caching more than one page ahead in documents. I definitely do not think that the sounds are too loud with it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Super helpful at a great price
Cons: Screen gets dirty fast
This is my first tablet, so I can't make any comparisons, but I can say I really like this one.
I read a lot of the reviews on it before purchasing it and I was honestly a little concerned--especially about the issues people said they had with the volume. I saw a few places that people felt it was too low, even when they adjusted it all the way up. I didn't have this problem at all, with or without headphones. In fact, I had to turn it way down in order to use my headphones comfortably. (Just a cheap pair. Not anything that would amp up the volume in any way.) Everything sounds fine to me.
The screen picked up fingerprints really easily, but assume they all do that and have read it'll stop once I ... get a screen protector.
This will be very helpful at home and at work. I teach classes and sponsor clubs that require a lot of organization. We go on several field trips too, so now I have something smaller than my laptop that I'm more willing to bring along. (Sitting in a hotel lobby using their PC while everyone watches me is always really awkward feeling, even if I am just looking up directions for our bus drivers. Haha!) I've only had this tablet a couple days and have found tons of apps for it that will help with teaching and definitely with stuff around the house.
The price was very good in comparison to many of the other tablets out there. From what I've seen on my friends' tablets, this one is comparable to some of the trendier ones that cost $100+ more than the Acer. If you want something that works and aren't just trying to impress people, I would highly suggest this one over others.
I didn't give it a perfect 5/5 because I had a hard time trying to figure out some of the stuff and it's kind of awkward trying to get to some of the settings. I've noticed the larger apps take a couple seconds longer than the others to load, but that's no different than if I were using a computer, so no real complaints. It's all totally tolerable once you get used to where every ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Affordable tablet with loads of features
Item.Review: The world is moving towards tablets and I thought it is the right time I get one. I was not able to afford the Apple iPad and decided to go for something similar but less expensive and my eyes caught the Acer 16GB iconia tab A series 10.1 tablet. The tablet works on the NVIDIA tegra 2 Dual-Core 1GHz processor and has a HD resolution of 1280x800. Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Just about everything
Cons: No HDMI output
I purchased the A200 tablet after doing lots and lots of research. I looked at about 4 other models such as the Samsung Galaxy, Motorolla XOOM and the iPad. The A200 came out on top by a mile because it has all of the necessary tools and more.
I am a student as well as a media guru. It has a nifty program called Evernote pre-downloaded and ready to use right out of the box. It stores notes in chronological order and even allows for the attachment of a video, picture or sound bite. I use Evernote almost every day in my classes because it is so functional.
Not only does it function well as a student tablet it is also great for playing games and watching videos and movies. The pixel density is very good and the viewi ... ng angles are exceptional. I've watched many movies on Netflix since I purchased it. Battery life is about 6 hours if you watch movies the whole time. It gets through a school day without trouble at all.
The touchscreen is very responsive and the settings can easily be manipulated to fit your preference. The 16G onboard memory gives you ample space to store any and all of your files. The SD card slot is a huge plus seeing as the iPad doesn't even have that ability.
My only gripe is that there is no rear-facing camera or HDMI Output. Then again who buys a tablet to use as an everyday camera? The absence of an HDMI output is not of huge significance to me seeing as i have a Smart TV.
Overall the A200 is incredible. I would buy it over the iPad any day. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, features
Cons: Camera, lack of accessories
The Acer A200 is my first tablet purchase, and I'm amazed with the capability of this "bargain" tablet.
I purchased in February 2012, for $299. A nearby store was offering the tablet at a lower price, and Best Buy called the competitor, confirmed that they had it in stock, and then matched the price. Add to that a $45 Reward Zone certificate that I applied to the purchase, and I walked out the door spending only $267 including tax.
I bought the A200 after comparing it with the Apple iPad, iPad 2, the Samsung 10.1, the Motorola Xoom, Kindle Fire, Nook and Blackberry PlayBook. The 3G versions of these tablets weren't even considered because I was searching for value, and not another opportunity for my wireles ... s company to drain more money from my wallet. Besides, if a user really wants 3G/4G connectivity with this tablet, it's as simple as setting up a wireless smartphone as a mobile hotspot and then connecting the tablet through the phone. The cost and monthly allowance is the same as the data plan for the tablet alone in the research I've done, and the phone can serve as a mobile hotspot for up to five devices.
I purchased the A200 after my comparison with each of these tablets through reading other user's experiences (limited for the A200, as it is so new), comparison of specifications, and hands-on use of each option. In the case of the more expensive tablets, I couldn't justify spending an additional $200 or more just to have an HDMI port (which the A200 doesn't have), a rear camera or even a higher resolution camera front camera, or 3G service. After using my A200 for a little more than a week, I know I made the right choice.
As for the A200 tablet and it's Android operating system, here's what I've found:
Positives:
- Price, as I mentioned above. If you want a few additional capabilities for an additional $200+, of course that's your choice. For me, I couldn't justify spending the extra money.
- MiniSD port. This was a must-have for me, as the built-in 16 ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Better than I could have ever imagined.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set-up, good price, updated quickly.
Cons: Cannot find a proper case for it, yet.
I was initially going to purchase the Kindle Fire after I played a little bit with my coworker's device. Once things did not work out in the way I thought they would, I was able to do more research on my purchase. I looked through review sites and even on Best Buy and then stumbled upon this tablet. It was priced nicely and when I tested it out in the store, I was amazed. It was everything I would hope it was and the Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (Which was in the running for my choices) proved to be too buggy for me (The display unit froze up on me while I was trying it). I made my purchase on the 8th of this month, and much to my delight, it updated to ICS last Wednesday evening. Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for staying connected outside of the office
Item.Review:
Pros: Funtionality, portability
I have a bunch of projects going on right now. I am helping to develop an educational program for middle school-aged boys, overseeing the hiring of instructors for a sister program (to the previously mentioned educational program), functioning as a student services coordinator for a group of undergraduate students; and, I am teaching an upper-division, undergraduate class all while doing my very best to finish my dissertation (this millennium). Needless to say, I am somewhat busy. This tablet helps me maintain my sanity precisely because I am able to work on all of these things, on the go.
Except for maybe 6 hours a week, I have my son with me, and he could care less about my deadlines. He needs to be on the move; and, I can accommodate that no ... w because the Acer A200 now functions as my mobile office.
So, then, on to the Acer A200. I can truly say that it has made my life a little easier. It's portability is ideal for me right now, because I work primarily from home, but also occasional from campus. I consider myself something of an Android pro. So set up was easy; it was so easy that, in reality, you can be an Android novice and still have it up and running in no time.
I really like the available usb be port. I can move files seamlessly and download things to a flashdrive, whenever the tablet is absent, and simply upload later. This may be my favorite feature (in addition to the price-point). The speed is good; there are faster (albeit more expensive) tablets on the market, but this one seems to do everything I need it to do rather quickly. Thus far I have no complaints.
I highly recommend this device! expand » « collapse

I found the leaked ICS for this online and installed it. It is super nice. :D

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality Construction; Price; Android; Full-size USB Port
Cons: Thickness; Weight
This tablet isn't as thin or light as some other tablets on the market (Galaxy Tab, iPad 2, Transformer Prime), and it doesn't have a rear-facing camera, but it's solidly built without a huge bezel and upgradable to Ice Cream Sandwich. It's got a micro SD slot for upgrading it's storage, and is one of the few tablets that can read files from a USB flash drive. It's not the most powerful tablet on the market, but it's much cheaper. A great value for anyone looking for a reasonably-priced 10-inch Android tablet.

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price for what you get!
Cons: Few Accessories
This is my first tablet purchase. I have a desktop and laptop but wanted something more portable. I have been holding out for a good Android-based tablet. I came in to Best Buy to look at the Samsung Galaxy but left with the Acer A200. I was sold on it having USB ports and MicroSD card slot.
I got it home and it took me all of 2hrs to get basic setup done. It has worked flawlessly since then. I have hooked it up via the USB to my PC and set up folders/copied pictures and music. I have hooked up a USD hard drive to also copy files onto the tablet. I put my music files on a 8GB microsd card and inserted it without any problems.
Bottom line, everything I have tried has worked without any issues.
My on ... ly complaint – if you can call it a complaint – is that the device is so new there is not much information on Acer’s support web site. There also are not many accessories available – but I think this device will be a hit so I see that changing soon. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great tablet at a great price
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, size, Value Great quality build
Cons: Sound is a bit low in some apps
I Bought this tablet from best buy on Jan 7th and after 1 week the only thing i seem to not like about it is that the audio levels in some applications are a bit low especially in skype. i have to use my phone headset to make skype calls or be in a very quite room. but other than that this is an amazing tablet. super fast. all the apps you can imagine. LCD is amazingly bright and vibrant. Super sturdy build, Better than A500
i like the full size usb port for my flash drives and i can even connect my dslr(canon 60D) and use the dslr remote app to take pictures and change camera settings from the tablet. And i can transfer photos.
and another downer. hulu is not supported yet. ... But when you open the app a dislcaimer says that they are working hard on getting it ready for the near future.
App recommendations ES file explorer- to browse your sd card and ilnternal memory Dr Battery - for shutting down apps fully. Flash player - to view flash netflix - to blow your mind with unlimited movies Samsung remote - to scare people when they are waching a samsung tv "who's muting the TV"
for the kids
Kid mode- the best kids app ever . even sends you weekly report cards for each child. and its free. And you can lock the app from exiting. so you don't have to keep starting up the app again . this app can also access other apps on your tablet from within this app so those games get locked as well.
all in all great tablet expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray

Cons: Sound Quality
I purchased this product yesterday for my father as a birthday gift and unfortunately I will be returning it today to get a different tablet. The tablet comes with a ton of features (standard USB port, micro SD, mini USB) yet lacks in one major area, sound quality. My father planned to use the tablet mainly for listening to music and watching movies. We loaded the Netfix app to watch a movie. We could barely hear anything even with headphones in. A spent 20 minutes reading every manual just to ensure that I was not missing anything, but the sound is just that bad. My iPhone speakers sound much better than this. Oh by the way, no HDMI port. It will be great for surfing the web, but if you plan to listen to mu ... sic or watch movies, look elsewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Acer ICONIA Tab A200-10g16u 16 GB - Titanium gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Especially for the money, a great product
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price, very fast, great data port options for a tablet
Cons: Heavier than the competition's offerings
This tablet has hardware that matches up with ANY of the bigger name brands, from Toshiba to Motorola, and it includes a wider array of data porting. It has a full USB port to which you can attach a thumb drive, plus a mini USB port with a cable to attach directly to your pc. None of that technology is proprietary in any way, meaning you don't have to buy special connectors to hook up to your pc. It is a little heavier than the competition, but the additional data port options make it worth it, in my opinion. Beautiful display, graphics look good, dual core Tegra processor means it moves through apps easily, plus, it is probably the least expensive option with any ... thing like its comparable hardware on the market.. Great product! expand » « collapse
